word_mean: 预后的：就预后提供指征的

sentence.Network_en: He regarded the bad weather as a prognostic of failure.
sentence.Network_cn: 他将坏天气视为失败的预兆.

sentence.Network_en: Conclusion : MT can be taken as a prognostic index of breast cancer.
sentence.Network_cn: 本研究结果表明,MT可作为判断乳腺癌预后的指标之一.

sentence.Network_en: This pressure may stem from prognostic, professional, social, and economic factors.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种压力可能来源于疾病的预后 、 (医生的)专业 、 社会和经济因素等.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin prognosticus from Greek prognōstikos, from prognōsis (see prognosis)

means.word_mean: 1. a sign of something about to happen;

sentences.sentence: "he looked for an omen before going into battle"

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to prediction; having value for making predictions
